title: Mouse Keybindings (side buttons) not working.
body: I have a Logitech 502 and the two side buttons that I have previously used for keybindings have suddenly stopped working. I presumed it was due to a Windows 10 update that I had recently installed but after uninstalling it, the problem still persists. The menu won't even recognize me pressing the buttons when I try to change the binding. I've also tried reinstalling League, Logitech drivers, and the W10 updates. Also ran Logitech software and League Client as admin and neither worked.

replies.body:
Most of the time these issues with not being able to keybind mouse buttons can be traced back to using the Windows Creator Update, so if you're still running that let's try reverting back to the normal Windows and see if that works. 

With that being said, we are still working on making sure those keybinds work for all of our players. I don't have a timeline on it, but in the meantime make sure that you're trying to bind those mouse buttons through the in-game settings as opposed to the client settings. Go into a practice game, try changing those bindings, and let me know if that works!

You want me to revert back to the previous version of Windows only so I can bind 2 buttons?
No thank you. I'll wait for a fix. Hopefully this year.

Would be Great if I could do that, unfortunately, this is a fresh win10 install.

Meaning I cannot revert, as it was installed on first boot.

Guys, the solution is to bind those buttons to anything else. for my case i changed them to 5 and 6 and now working.
I am reverting back to an earlier version of Windows 10, hopefully that works because this issue is annoying as hell and has definitely negatively impacted my performance as a support!
